den Dunnen JT, Dalgleish R, Maglott DR, Hart RK, Greenblatt MS, McGowan-Jordan J, Roux AF, Smith T, Antonarakis SE, Taschner PE. HGVS Recommendations for the Description of Sequence Variants: 2016 Update. Hum Mutat. 2016 Jun;37(6):564-9. doi: 10.1002/humu.22981. Epub 2016 Mar 25. PubMed PMID: 26931183. Sequence variants available from: https://varnomen.hgvs.org/.

Standards and guidelines for the interpretation of sequence variants: a joint consensus recommendation of the American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics and the Association for Molecular Pathology. Genet Med. 2015 May;17(5):405-24. doi: 10.1038/gim.2015.30. Epub 2015 Mar 5. PubMed PMID: 25741868; PubMed Central PMCID: PMC4544753.

details.purpose: Wird verwendet, um Ergebnisse und Annotationen zu einer im Genom durch einen Sequenzierungstest gefundenen Variante zu berichten.
details.use:
Verwenden Sie diesen Archetyp, um über Befunde und Annotationen zu einer im Genom durch einen Sequenzierungstest gefundenen Variante zu berichten.
Dieser Archetyp ist für die Verwendung im SLOT "Testergebnis" des Archetyps OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result vorgesehen. Es soll ein einheitlicher Rahmen für die Verschachtelung eines spezifischen CLUSTER-Archetyps einer genomischen Variante innerhalb des SLOTs "Structured variant" bereitgestellt werden.
Dieser Archetyp ermöglicht die Darstellung genomischer Varianten sowohl in der HGVS-Syntax in einem Inline-Parsable-Element als auch in einer atomar strukturierten Form durch Verwendung eines verschachtelten CLUSTER-Archetyps für bestimmte Variantentypen. Wenn beide Darstellungen gleichzeitig verwendet werden, müssen sie identische Daten darstellen.
details.misuse: Nicht zur Darstellung von Informationen über den Vergleich mehrerer Proben verwenden. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck einen spezifischen Archetyp.

details.purpose: For å registrere resultater og annoteringer relatert til en enkelt variant funnet i en genomisk sekvens.
details.use:
Brukes for å registrere resultater og annoteringer relatert til en enkelt variant funnet i en genomisk sekvens.
Denne arketypen er ment å bli nøstet og brukt i elementet "Testresultat" SLOTet i arketypen "OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result (Laboratorieresultat)". Arketypen "Genetisk variant resultat" er ment å gi et konsistent rammeverk for å nøste enhver spesifikk genetisk variant CLUSTER-arketype i SLOTet "Strukturert variantbeskrivelse".
Denne arketypen gjør det mulig å registrere genomiske varianter i en HGVS-syntaks både som et integrert strukturert element (inline parseable) og i en egen enkeltstående strukturert form ved bruk av en nøstet CLUSTER-arketype for den spesifikke varianttypen. Hvis man bruker begge disse metodene å registrere en varianttype på, må disse representere identiske data.
details.misuse: Brukes ikke for å registrere sammenlikninger av genetiske varianter fra flere prøver, bruk spesifikke arketyper for dette.

details.purpose: To report findings and annotations related to one variant found in the genome by a sequencing test.
details.keywords: variation, VCF, variant, genetic, genomic, variant calling, sequence, mutation, allele, genotype
details.use:
Use to report findings and annotations related to one variant found in the genome by a sequencing test.
This archetype has been designed to be nested in the 'Test result' SLOT within the OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result archetype. It is intended to provide a consistent framework for nesting any specific genomic variant CLUSTER archetype within the 'Structured variant' SLOT.
This archetype allows the recording of genomic variants in both the HGVS syntax in an inline parsable element, and an atomic, structured form through the use of a nested CLUSTER archetype for specific variant types. If both of those representations are used simultaneously, they need to represent identical data.
details.misuse: Not to be used for recording information about the comparison of several samples. Use a specific archetype for this purpose.

translations.author: Aurelie Tomczak, Natalia Strauch
Institute of Pathology, University Hospital Heidelberg, Medizinische Hochschule Hannover
au.tomczak@yahoo.com, Strauch.Natalia@mh-hannover.de

items.items: Findings and annotations related to one variant found in a human individual by a sequencing test.
Structured details about the bioinformatic analysis workflow or the protocol that is used.
Structured details about the specific version of the human sequence assembly used for annotation.

For example: 'GCF_000001405.38'.
Source name: 'NCBI'. Accession number: 'GCF_000001405'. Version number: 'GCF_000001405.38'. URL: 'https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/assembly/GCF_000001405.38/'.
Structured details about the transcript which is potentially affected by the variant.
Structured details about the transcribed reference sequence.
For example: Source name: 'NCBI'. Accession number: 'NM_015557'. Version number: 'NM_015557.2'. URL: 'https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/nuccore/304361774'.
The human readable name for the region of interest.
For example: 'exon number', 'intron number', 'splice site' or other.
Description of the variation at the DNA level following the HGVS nomenclature.
Description of the variation at the protein level following the HGVS nomenclature.
Codified type for associated amino acid marker.
Estimate of the effects that the variant may have on the transcript.
Structured details about the reference used to calculate the predicted impact.
Human readable version of the predicted impact.
Structured details about the gene carrying the variant.
The official gene symbol approved by the HGNC, which is a short abbreviated form of the gene name.
The full gene name approved by the HGNC that conveys the character or function of the gene.
For example 'Chromodomain helicase DNA binding protein 5'.
The ID of the transcript with the highest predicted impact.
Structured details about the evolutionary conservation.
Structured details about the reference used to calculate the conservation score.
The number of reads that support the reported variant.
The relative frequency of a particular allele in the population.
Structured details about the database used to calculate the allele frequency.
The format for the genotype should be value separated by either of / or | (0 for the reference allele, 1 for the first alternate, etc.). For example: '1 | 0' or '0/0/1'.
The level of occurrence of a single DNA marker within a set of chromosomes.
This is the human readable version of genotype, e.g.: 'Heterozygous', 'Homozygous'.
Conditional genotype quality, encoded as a Phred quality.
Structured description of the genomic variant.

This element is set to multiple occurrence to allow templates to be built with several different variant types allowed. However, when storing data, there should never be more than one CLUSTER archetype inserted here.
If both this SLOT and the 'Variant' data element are used simultaneously, they need to represent identical data.
The relative frequency of an allele at a particular locus.
Interpretation of the variation linked to a specific paper.
The reference to the specific research paper.
Single word or phrase describing the reported impact of the specific variant.
For example: 'activating', 'deactivating', 'dysfunction', 'gain of function'. Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
The fraction of gene region covered by copy number.
States if the gene is part of a fusion gene and if it is the first or second part of the fusion gene.
The clinical significance according to the ACMG recommendations.
The number of the exon which is part of the fusion.
The total number of reads mapped at this specific location.
Structured details about the quality filters that have been applied to the data.
This field is derived from the FILTER column of VCF.
For example: 'at this site the quality is below 10'.
Did the variant pass the quality filter?
Record as 'True' if the filter was passed.
The ratio of the strand bias.
The Phred-scaled p-value of the strand bias.
A comma separated list of the log10-scaled genotype likelihoods for all possible genotypes, given the reference and the alternate alleles.
Identification of the specimen used for the genomic result.

In some situations, a single OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result archetype will contain multiple CLUSTER.specimen archetypes and multiple CLUSTER.genomic_variant_result archetypes. In these situations, this 'Specimen identifier' data element is needed to be able to connect the results with the correct specimens.
The sequence at a given position is identical to the reference sequence.
A deletion in the amino acid sequence.
A duplication in the amino acid sequence.
A frameshift in the amino acid sequence.
A variant in a sequence affecting the translation initiation codon.
An insertion in the amino acid sequence.
An insertion/deletion in the amino acid sequence.
One amino acid is replaced by another amino acid.
An amino acid is replaced by a translational stop codon (termination codon).
A variant in a DNA sequence that does not change the amino acid sequence of the encoded protein.
A variant in a sequence affecting the translational stop codon.
First part of a fusion gene.
Second part of a fusion gene.
Distance in nucleotides between mutation and exon–intron junction.
Description of the variation at the RNA level following the HGVS nomenclature.
Description of the variation at the genomic level following the HGVS nomenclature.

For example: 'g.33038255C>A'.
If both this element and the 'Structured variant' SLOT are used simultaneously, they need to represent identical data.
A reference to a specific variation recorded into an external biological variation database.

For example: 'rs123456' (Item name) from 'dbSNP' (Knowledge base name) 'version 151' (Knowledge base version). This CLUSTER.knowledge_base_reference archetype is repeatable to allow several different IDs from different databases for the same variant.
Funn og annotasjon av en enkelt variant, funnet ved hjelp av en genetisk undersøkelse, hos et menneskelig individ.
Strukturerte detaljer om den bioinformatiske pipeline (Bioinformatics analysis workflow) som er brukt i analysen eller hvilken protokoll som er brukt.
Strukturerte detaljer om den spesifikke versjonen av det humane referansegenomet brukt for annoteringen.

For eksempel: "GCF_000001405.38"
Source name: NCBI Accession number: GCF_000001405 Version number: GCF_000001405.38 URL: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/assembly/GCF_000001405.38/
Strukturerte detaljer om transkriptet som potensielt påvirker varianten.
Strukturerte detaljer om den transkriberte referansesekvensen.
For eksempel: Source name: NCBI Accession number: NM_015557 Version number: NM_015557.2 URL: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/nuccore/304361774
Et menneskelig lesbart navn for den aktuelle DNA regionen.
For eksempel: Exon nummer (#), intron nummer (#), spleisesete (splice site) eller annet.
Beskrivelse av DNA varianten i henhold til HGVS nomenklaturen.
Beskrivelse av varianten i proteinet (aminosyreendringen) i henhold til HGVS nomenklaturen.
Antatt betydning varianten kan ha på transkripsjonen.
Strukturert detaljer om kunnskapbasen som er brukt til å kalkulere den predikerte betydningen.
Menneskelig lesbar versjon av den predikerte betydningen.
Detaljer om genet som inneholder varianten.
Det offisielle nomenklaturen til genet godkjent av HGNC, som er en kortversjon av det genetiske navnet.
Det fullstendige navnet på genet, godkjent av HGNC, som beskriver karakteren eller funksjonen til genet.
For eksempel: "Chromodomain helicase DNA binding protein 5".
ID til det transkriptet med den høyeste predikerte betydningen.
Strukturerte detaljer om den evolusjonære bevaringen. Engelsk: Conservation.
Detaljer om verktøyet brukt til å kalkulere bevaringspoeng. Engelsk: conservation score.
Det tildelte bevaringspoenget. Engelsk: conservation score.
Antall avlesninger ("reads") for hvert allel som støtter den rapporterte varianten. På engelsk: Allele depth.
Den relative frekvensen av et bestemt allel i befolkningen.
Strukturert detaljer om kunnskapsbasen som er brukt til å kalkulere allelefrekvensen i populasjonen.
Genotypen kodet som en allelverdi separert med enten "/" eller "|" (0 for referanseallelet, 1 for det første allelet, osv.). For eksempel '1 | 0' or '0/0/1'.
Nivået på forekomst av en enkelt DNA-markør i et sett med kromosomer.
Dette er den menneskelige lesbare versjonen av en genotype, f.eks. "heterozygot", "homozygot".

Dette elementet kan ha multiple forekomster slik at man i et templat eller brukergrensesnitt kan tilby registrering av flere forskjellige varianttyper. Ved lagring av dataen skal det allikevel ikke brukes mer enn en CLUSTER-arketype her.
Hvis både dette SLOTet og "Variant" dataelementet brukes samtidig, må disse representere det samme.
Den relative frekvensen av et allel i et bestemt lokus Engelsk: Allele frequency.
Tolkning av mutasjonen knyttet til en bestemt publikasjon.
Et enkelt ord eller frase som beskriver den rapporterte innvirkning av den spesifikke varianten.
For eksempel: 'aktivering', 'deaktivering', 'dysfunksjon', 'økt funksjon'. Koding med termonologi er foretrukket om mulig.
Andelen av genregionen som er dekket av kopitall.
Oppgir om dette genet er en del av et fusjonsgen, og om dette er den første eller andre delen av det fusjonerte genet.
Klassifisering av genetiske sekvensvarianter med hensyn til patogenitet i henhold til ACMGs anbefalinger.
Nummeret til eksonet som enten er slutten eller begynnelsen av fusjonen.
Detaljer om kvalitetfilteret som har blitt brukt på dataene.
Dette feltet er avledet fra FILTER-kolonnen til VCF (Variant Call Format).
Fot eksempel: "på dette filteret er kvaliteten under 10".
Registrer som "sann" (true) hvis varianten oppfyller (passerer) kvalitetsfilteret.
Alle mulig sannsynlige genotyper listet opp i en kommaseparert log10 sannsynlighetsskala.
Identifikator for prøvematerialet som brukes til den genetiske testen.

I enkelte tilfeller vil en enkel Laboratorieresultat-arketype inneholde multiple Prøvemateriale-arketyper og multiple Genetisk variant resultat-arketyper. I disse tilfellene trenger man dette "Prøvemateriale" dataelementet for å kunne koble disse resultatene til det riktige prøvematerialet.
En variant med usikker klinisk betydning (VUS).
Sekvensen på en gitt posisjon er identisk med referansesekvensen. Engelsk: Wild Type.
En delesjon (fjerning/sletting) i aminosyresekvensen. Engelsk: Deletion.
En duplikasjon i aminosyresekvensen. Engelsk: Duplication.
Endring i leserammen til en aminosyresekvens. Engelsk: Frameshift.
En variant i en sekvens som påvirker kodonet som initierer (igangsetter) translasjonen. Engelsk: Initiating Methionine.
En insersjon (insetting) i aminosyresekvensen. Engelsk: Insertion.
En insersjon og delesjon (delin) i aminosyresekvensen. Engelsk: Insertion and deletion.
En aminosyre er erstattet av en annen aminosyre.
En aminosyre er erstattet av et translasjon stopp-kodon (termineringskodon).
En variant i DNA sekvensen som ikke gir noen endring i aminosyresekvensen i genproduktet. Også kalt "stille endring/mutasjon". Engelsk: Silent.
En variant i en sekvens som påvirker translasjonens stopp-kodon (termineringskodon). Engelsk: Stop Codon Mutation.
Ytterligere informasjon som ikke er registrert andre steder.
Avstanden i nuklotider mellom mutasjonen og exon-intron overgangen (spleisesetet). Engelsk: splicing site.
Beskrivelse av varianten i RNA i henhold til HGVS nomenklaturen.
Beskrivelse av genvarianten i henhold til HGVS-nomenklaturen.

For eksempel: "g.33038255C>A".
Hvis man bruker både dette dataelementet og SLOTet "Strukturert variantbeskrivelse" samtidig, må disse bety det samme (representere de samme dataene).
En referanse til en spesifikk variant registrert i en ekstern biologisk variantdatabase.

For eksempel: rs123456 (variant ID) fra dbSNP (Kildenavn/kunnskapsbase) version 151 (Kildeversjon). Dette kunnskapsbase/kildehenvisnings CLUSTERet kan repeteres slik at det er mulig å registrere flere variant IDer fra forskjellige databaser for den samme varianten.
Ergebnisse und Annotationen zu einer Variante, die durch einen Sequenzierungstest bei einem Menschen gefunden wurde.
Structured details about the bioinformatic analysis workflow or the protocol that is used.
Structured details about the specific version of the human sequence assembly used for annotation.

For example, "GCF_000001405.38"
Source name: NCBI Accession number: GCF_000001405 Version number: GCF_000001405.38 URL: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/assembly/GCF_000001405.38/
Structured details about the transcript which is potentially affected by the variant.
Structured details about the transcribed reference sequence.
For example: Source name: NCBI Accession number: NM_015557 Version number: NM_015557.2 URL: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/nuccore/304361774
A human readable name for the region of interest.
For example: Exon number, intron number, splice site or other.
Description of the variation at the DNA level following the HGVS nomenclature.
Description of the variation at the protein level following the HGVS nomenclature.
Codified type for associated Amino Acid Marker.
Estimate of the effects that the variant may have on the transcript.
Structured details about the reference used to calculate the predicted impact.
Human readable version of the predicted impact.
Structured details about the gene carrying the variant.
The official gene symbol approved by the HGNC, which is a short abbreviated form of the gene name.
The full gene name approved by the HGNC that convey the character or function of the gene.
For example "Chromodomain helicase DNA binding protein 5".
The ID of the transcript with the highest predicted impact.
Structured details about the evolutionary conservation.
Structured details about the reference used to calculate the conservation score.
The number of reads that support the reported variant.
The relative frequency of a particular allele in the population.
Structured details about the database used to calculate the allele frequency.
The format for the genotype should be value separated by either of / or | (0 for the reference allele, 1 for the first alternate, etc.). For example: "1 | 0" or "0/0/1".
The level of occurrence of a single DNA Marker within a set of chromosomes.
This is the human readable version of genotype, e.g.: "Heterozygous", "Homozygous".
Conditional genotype quality, encoded as a Phred quality.
Structured description of the genomic variant.

This element is set to multiple occurrence to allow templates to be built with several different variant types allowed. However, when storing data, there should never be more than one CLUSTER archetype inserted here.
If both this SLOT and the "Variant" data element are used simultaneously, they need to represent identical data.
The relative frequency of an allele at a particular locus.
Interpretation of the variation linked to a specific paper.
The reference to the specific research paper.
Single word or phrase describing the reported impact of the specific variant.
For example: "activating", "deactivating", "dysfunction", "gain of function". Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
The fraction of gene region covered by copy number.
States if the Gene is part of a Fusion Gene and if it is the first or second part of the Fusion Gene.
The clinical significance according to the ACMG recommendations.
The number of the exon which is part of the fusion.
The total number of reads mapped at this specific location.
Structured details about the quality filters that have been applied to the data.
This field is derived from the FILTER column of VCF.
For example "at this site the quality is below 10".
Did the variant pass the quality filter?
Record as "True" if the filter was passed.
The ratio of the strand bias.
The Phred-scaled p-value of the strand bias.
A comma separated list of the log10-scaled genotype likelihoods for all possible genotypes, given the reference and the alternate alleles.
Identification of the specimen used for the genomic result.

In some situations, a single OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result archetype will contain multiple CLUSTER.specimen archetypes and multiple CLUSTER.genomic_variant_result archetypes. In these situations, this "Specimen identifier" data element is needed to be able to connect the results with the correct specimens.
The sequence at a given position is identical to the reference sequence.
A deletion in the amino acid sequence.
A duplication in the amino acid sequence.
A frameshift in the amino acid sequence.
A variant in a sequence affecting the translation initiation codon.
An insertion in the amino acid sequence.
An insertion/deletion in the amino acid sequence.
One amino acid is replaced by another amino acid.
An amino acid is replaced by a translational stop codon (termination codon).
A variant in a DNA sequence that does not change the amino acid sequence of the encoded protein.
A variant in a sequence affecting the translational stop codon.
First part of a fusion gene.
Second part of a fusion gene.
Distance in nucleotides between mutation and exon–intron junction.
Description of the variation at the RNA level following the HGVS nomenclature.
Description of the variation at the genomic level following the HGVS nomenclature.

For example: "g.33038255C>A".
If both this element and the "Structured variant" SLOT are used simultaneously, they need to represent identical data.
A reference to a specific variation recorded into an external biological variation database.

For example: rs123456 (Item name) from dbSNP (Knowledge base name) version 151 (Knowledge base version). This CLUSTER.knowledge_base_reference archetype is repeatable to allow several different IDs from different databases for the same variant.
